title: Why did scientists find the newly discovered parts of the human body only recently? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t think the question makes sense. You would need to be more specific. The human body has for centuries been examined sliced dissected slivered and generally pulled apart more thoroughly than how a 10 year old might dissect their granddad’s broken reel to reel tape recorder, given by said granddad in full knowledge the kid will love it - and it will never work again, but will almost certainly create some blinding flashes from charged capacitors that will give little Neddy a healthy respect for electricity! Just me? The flashes were amazing!!
Why did scientists find the newly discovered parts of the human body only recently? That IS what ‘newly discovered’ means, it was only recent.
